devdoc.author: Eduardo Moreno - Optimized Version
devdoc.details: Implements constant product formula x * y = k without any fees using structs for gas optimization. This contract allows users to add/remove liquidity and swap between two tokens using single storage access per function.

params.amountA: The amount of tokenA involved in the liquidity action
params.amountB: The amount of tokenB involved in the liquidity action
params.isAdded: True if liquidity was added, false if removed
params.liquidity: The amount of liquidity tokens minted (if added) or burned (if removed)
params.tokenA: The address of the first token in the pair
params.tokenB: The address of the second token in the pair

params.amountIn: The amount of tokenIn that was swapped
params.amountOut: The amount of tokenOut that was received
params.tokenIn: The address of the token sent into the swap
params.tokenOut: The address of the token received from the swap

_getPairHash(address,address).details: Ensures consistent ordering of token addresses (tokenA < tokenB) before hashing to guarantee the same hash for (A, B) and (B, A)

returns.pairHash: The keccak256 hash of the ordered token addresses
returns.reversed: True if tokenA and tokenB were reversed to maintain order, false otherwise

addLiquidity(address,address,uint256,uin.details: Transfers `amountADesired` and `amountBDesired` from `msg.sender` to the contract, calculates the liquidity tokens to mint, updates reserves, and emits a `LiquidityAction` event Requires `amountADesired` and `amountBDesired` to be at least `amountAMin` and `amountBMin` respectively

params.amountADesired: Amount of first token to add
params.amountAMin: Minimum amount of first token to add, to prevent front-running
params.amountBDesired: Amount of second token to add
params.amountBMin: Minimum amount of second token to add, to prevent front-running
params.deadline: Maximum timestamp until which the transaction is valid
params.to: Address that will receive the liquidity tokens

returns.amountA: The actual amount of first token added
returns.amountB: The actual amount of second token added
returns.liquidity: The amount of liquidity tokens minted

getAmountOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Implements the constant product formula (x * y = k) to determine the amount of output tokens received for a given amount of input tokens

returns._0: amountOut Amount of output tokens to receive

getPrice(address,address).details: Calculates the price based on the current reserves of the pair The price is returned as a fixed-point number with 18 decimal places (wei equivalent)

returns.price: Price of tokenA in terms of tokenB, scaled by 1e18

getReserves(address,address).details: Retrieves the amounts of tokenA and tokenB held in the contract's reserves for a given pair

returns.reserveA: The current reserve amount of the first token
returns.reserveB: The current reserve amount of the second token

removeLiquidity(address,address,uint256,.details: Burns `liquidity` tokens from `msg.sender` and transfers proportional amounts of `tokenA` and `tokenB` back to the `to` address. Updates reserves and total liquidity, and emits a `LiquidityAction` event Requires the received amounts to be at least `amountAMin` and `amountBMin`

params.amountAMin: Minimum amount of first token to receive, to prevent front-running
params.amountBMin: Minimum amount of second token to receive, to prevent front-running
params.deadline: Maximum timestamp until which the transaction is valid
params.liquidity: Amount of liquidity tokens to burn
params.to: Address that will receive the tokens

returns.amountA: The actual amount of first token returned
returns.amountB: The actual amount of second token returned

swapExactTokensForTokens(uint256,uint256.details: Transfers `amountIn` of `path[0]` from `msg.sender` to the contract, calculates the output amount of `path[1]`, transfers `amountOut` to `to` address, updates reserves, and emits a `Swap` event Requires `amountOut` to be at least `amountOutMin`

params.amountIn: Amount of input tokens to swap
params.amountOutMin: Minimum amount of output tokens to receive, to prevent front-running
params.deadline: Maximum timestamp until which the transaction is valid
params.to: Address that will receive the output tokens

liquidityBalances.details: Maps pair hash => user address => liquidity balance

pairs.details: Uses keccak256(abi.encodePacked(tokenA, tokenB)) as key for deterministic ordering to ensure that a pair (tokenA, tokenB) always maps to the same data regardless of input order

devdoc.title: SimpleSwap

LiquidityAction(address,address,uint256,.notice: Emitted when liquidity is added or removed from a pair

_getPairHash(address,address).notice: Internal function to get a deterministic hash for a token pair

addLiquidity(address,address,uint256,uin.notice: Adds liquidity to a token pair pool

getAmountOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates the output amount for a swap given an input amount and current reserves

getPrice(address,address).notice: Gets the current price of tokenA in terms of tokenB

getReserves(address,address).notice: Gets the current reserve amounts for a token pair

liquidityBalances(bytes32,address).notice: Stores liquidity token balances for each user in each pair

pairs(bytes32).notice: Maps a deterministic token pair hash to its PairData

removeLiquidity(address,address,uint256,.notice: Removes liquidity from a token pair pool

swapExactTokensForTokens(uint256,uint256.notice: Swaps an exact amount of input tokens for output tokens

userdoc.notice: An optimized automated market maker (AMM) for token swapping without fees
